features: WHOLE TODDLER SUPPORT||: For immune support, brain development, and digestive health
DIGESTIVE HEALTH: The first US toddler nutritional drink with an exclusive blend of 5 HMO prebiotics. HMOs support the growth of healthy gut bacteria
BRAIN & EYE DEVELOPMENT: Our exclusive blend of DHA for brain and eye development, lutein to support eye health, and vitamin E to support developing cells
NO ARTIFICIAL GROWTH HORMONES: Also has no palm olein oil and is non-GMO§
EBT ELIGIBLE: Eligible to be purchased with Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits in select stores
body.description: Go & Grow 360 Total Care by Similac* is the first US toddler nutritional drink with 5 HMOs. HMO prebiotics support digestive health and feed good bacteria in the gut, where 70% of the immune system exists. Two servings† have 28 key nutrients to support growth and development . Go & Grow 360 Total Care has our exclusive blend of DHA for brain and eye development, lutein to support eye health, and vitamin E to support developing cells. It has no artificial growth hormones‡ and is non-GMO.§ Designed for toddlers ages 12-36 months old. * Not for children with galactosemia. † 1 serving is defined as 15g powder mixed into 4 fl oz of water. ‡ No significant difference has been shown between milk derived from rbST-treated and non-rbST-treated cows. § Ingredients not genetically engineered. || Go & Grow Toddler Drinks are not for sole source nutrition.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Toddler Nutritional Drink Go & Grow 360 Total Care by Similac Toddler Nutritional Drink has 5 HMOs. Two servings* have 28 important nutrients to complement your toddler’s diet. * 1 serving is defined as 15 g in 4 fl oz of water. Immune Support Has ingredients to support your toddler’s developing immune system. Brain Development Helps provide building blocks to support your toddler’s developing brain. Digestive Health Go & Grow 360 Total Care by Similac has 5 different HMOs. HMO prebiotics support digestive health and feed good bacteria in the gut, where 70% of the immune system exists.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great for toddlers
reviews.reviewText: I have a 20 month old at home, this stuff is great when she needs a little extra during the day. She usually has 2 bottles a day, and I can feel confident that she is getting all of the nutrients she needs, just by using this as a supplement on top of her "adult" food

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for my 1 yr 3mth old👍👍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for our toddler who is transitioning away from breastfeeding!
reviews.reviewText: Our little one never drank formula and exclusively breastfed but we are in the process of weaning him and transitioning him to milk. I ordered this because I feel like it offers a lot more nutrition than cow's milk or nutmilk. He isn't guzzling it down like he would breastmilk but he definitely prefers this drink over any other milk we have attempted to give him! I like that its jam packed with nutrition because I can feel better amount him getting some nutrients versus an unknown amount with other milk products. It's convenient that it is a powder you mix because it is easy to take some on the go and be able to mix it up for him, especially when we are snacking or having a meal time where milk is not an option!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to mix formula
reviews.reviewText: Easy to mix, great for on the go. My toddler loves the taste.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Go and Grow Toddler Formula
reviews.reviewText: I have a very tall, thin 13 month old. He drinks whole milk without any issues, but I worry about his calorie intake matching his body type. I give him 4-6oz of this formula a day for a little extra peace of mind. He like it, both mixed with his milk and on its own. It doesn't clump, and it doesn't have an odd smell like other formulas. Using that small amount makes this can last for quite a while. At its current price of $25.99 it is a bit expensive, but if it isn't your primary milk source then it can be affordable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good For Transitioning, Somewhat Like Ensure
reviews.reviewText: It mixes much like normal formula does, and tastes something like unflavored Ensure, but a bit more metallic tasting.If your little one is already used to whole milk, this might be a bit of a challenge to feed them, but our kids aren't very picky thanks to taste testing dozens of different formulas over the years.I would only recommend this if whole milk isn't a good option for you. This formula is expensive, and much less convenient than just pouring some milk. Once your little one starts eating a lot of solids, the importance of formula somewhat wanes...
